response.overview: Daniel Chester French: American Sculptor is a 2022 documentary film by Eduardo Montes-Bradley about Daniel Chester French, a leading American sculptor best known for his rendering of the seated President Abraham Lincoln at the Lincoln Memorial in Washington, D.C. Produced by Heritage Film Project with the support of the National Trust for Historic Preservation and Chesterwood.[1] Significant support for this film came from the Morris and Alma Schapiro Fund.
response.title: Daniel Chester French: American Sculptor
